programme.title: Wanderlust
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy, an unemployed Manhattan businessman and his wife move into a seemingly idyllic, clothing-optional hippie commune called Elysium, which may cause more problems in their marriage than it solves(n)

programme.title: My Darling Clementine
programme.desc: Retired lawman Wyatt Earp accepts the post of Tombstone city marshal when one of his brothers is killed by cattle rustlers, and embarks on a crusade to bring his murderers to justice and drive lawlessness from the streets. Western, directed by John Ford, starring Henry Fonda, Victor Mature, Linda Darnell and Walter Brennan.(n)

programme.title: Love Happens
programme.desc: A self-help guru goes on a lecture tour after his wife's death, offering advice on how to cope with grief. However, when he falls in love he begins to realise he has yet to confront his own loss, while the object of his affection has a troubled past of her own to deal with. Romantic drama, starring Jennifer Aniston, Aaron Eckhart and Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson are asked to protect the last remaining member of the aristocratic Baskerville family, who is believed to be the target of a monstrous spectral hound roaming the remote Devon moors. Hammer version of Arthur Conan Doyle's mystery, starring Peter Cushing, Andre Morrell, Christopher Lee, John Le Mesurier and Miles Malleson.(n)

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: A teenager discovers he is the last in a long line of warriors destined to defend the world from dark forces. His duty now is to embark on a perilous journey through time to recover the six parts of a powerful mystical artefact and ensure it is returned to safe hands. Fantasy adventure, starring Alexander Ludwig, Christopher Eccleston and Ian McShane.(n)

programme.title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off
programme.desc: A cocky teenager plays truant from school and spends the day dragging his girlfriend and a reluctant friend into all manner of crazy adventures in the big city - while the school's dean of students vows to stop at nothing to prove the youngster is faking illness. Comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Mia Sara, Alan Ruck, Jennifer Grey, Jeffrey Jones and Charlie Sheen.(n)

programme.title: Chef
programme.desc: Carl Casper quits his job at a prestigious Los Angeles restaurant after refusing to compromise his creative integrity for the owner, and takes to the road to reignite his passion for the kitchen. He ends up in Miami, where he teams up with his ex-wife, his friend and his son to launch a food truck. Comedy, directed by and starring Jon Favreau. with Robert Downey Jr, Scarlett Johansson and Dustin Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Blood Ties
programme.desc: A police officer in 1970s New York takes in his older brother following his release from prison. The cop tries to help his sibling make a fresh start, finding honest work and reconnecting with the family he lost - but conflict erupts as the elder brother returns to a life of crime. Crime drama, starring Clive Owen, Billy Crudup, Marion Cotillard and James Caan.(n)

programme.title: Weekend
programme.desc: A gay man trying to make sense of his life leaves a party with his friends and goes to a nightclub in search of a one-night stand. He and the man he takes home that night end up spending the weekend together, and begin to realise that their developing relationship may be just what was missing in their lives. Romantic drama, starring Tom Cullen and Chris New.(n)

programme.title: The Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Three men gather at the funeral of a Spanish actress and countess who rose from peasant origins to become a Hollywood star. A movie director recalls how he made her famous, a PR agent remembers her doomed romance with a millionaire, and her aristocratic husband contemplates the events that destroyed their marriage. Satirical drama in flashback format, with Ava Gardner, Humphrey Bogart, Edmond O'Brien, Rossano Brazzi and Marius Goring.(n)

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: An American war correspondent joins Allied troops in 1944 as they prepare for their landing in Italy. A strategic blunder by their commanding officer gives German forces time to reinforce the area, leaving the reporter caught up in one of the campaign's fiercest battles. Second World War drama, starring Robert Mitchum, Peter Falk, Arthur Kennedy, Robert Ryan and Earl Holliman.(n)

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: One-eyed, over-the-hill US Marshal Rooster Cogburn reluctantly agrees to help a girl track down her father's killer. The quest is complicated by a Texas Ranger, who is also on the murderer's trail, and a host of villains who have few qualms about disposing of the meddling youngster and her protector. Western, starring an Oscar-winning John Wayne alongside Jeff Corey, Kim Darby, Glen Campbell, Robert Duvall and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: Feisty heroine Annie and her new boyfriend Alex take a cruise in the Bahamas, but the trip becomes a nightmare when they discover a vengeful computer genius - a former employee laid off because of his terminal illness - is also on board. He has secretly programmed the ship to crash into an oil tanker while he steals a cache of diamonds from the cargo. Action thriller sequel, with Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric and Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: The Other Woman

Their physical attraction is immediate, and although she realises she is risking everything, she cannot help herself from being drawn into a passionate affair. In time her husband grows suspicious, and eventually confronts her lover with a level of anger he never imagined himself capable of. Thriller, with Diane Lane, Olivier Martinez and Richard Gere.(n)

programme.title: Spring Baking Championship
programme.desc: The five bakers left in the Spring Baking Championship are challenged to bake for a birthday bash, making a birthday cake paired with homemade ice cream.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: With his campaign drawing to a close, Jamie Oliver is unsure the lessons he has taught to the people of Rotherham will stick after his departure. With this in mind, he approaches the local council in the hope that it will encourage the population to continue living healthily. He also organises a series of Pass It On street parties, culminating in a bash for the entire town. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri feasts on the tastes of Europe, in Tacoma he visits an Eastern European restaurant serving a hangover soup and a meat dish.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Sampling food straight of the grill, beginning in Los Angeles where he samples a hot pork sandwich and a Mediterranean lamb burger.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: The baker and celebrity chef travels to cities around the world to visit local bakeries and the bakers who work there.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps struggling owner and chef Mike, of Trends Restaurants in Staten Island which is currently at the mercy of his out-of-control staff.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After hearing rumours that customers are being served off-menu food, Esdras and Javi, owners of Mexicali Tacos in Los Angeles, call Charles to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team helps the owner of Spring Street Smoke House in Los Angeles, after he notices a decrease in his valuable fat trimmings.(n)

programme.desc: The Meldrews, Mrs Warboys and Nick Swainey spend a day boating on the river, but get marooned - so Victor sets out alone to fetch help and stumbles across a disturbing secret at an old people's home. Richard Wilson stars.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrews return home from a dreary holiday to find the neighbours about to sell their house to a weirdo - and while Victor is busy moaning about everything under the sun, Margaret considers embarking on an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del's latest foolproof scheme to make a million involves a spot of salmon-poaching, but the wheeler-dealer finds the bracing country air is not all it's cracked up to be. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: Joyce and Alan have financial concerns and consider downsizing, but - hoping to keep it quiet for the time being - they don't count on their friends being there when the estate agent arrives to look round. Maureen has finally decided to move elderly mum Joan into a residential home, while the men convince John that his sister-in-law's over-friendly behaviour is actually a form of sexual harassment and, having put up with it for 40 years, he decides it's time he finally spoke up. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and June Whitfield.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: They say age is but a number, and every year Joyce, Alan and the gang like to remind themselves of that by attending a 1960s-themed weekend at a seaside resort, and partying their evenings away. However, this time, Alan's in their bad books, having messed up the booking, leaving them with only two rooms between the six of them. Meanwhile, John is determined to prove he's not old and starts by taking on the climbing wall, and Carol bumps into an old friend, which could spell trouble for her relationship with Trevor. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and Paula Wilcox.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barraclough uncover the stash in his cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You.
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters embark on a decorating venture for Denzil. When they find a canary lying dead in its cage, they race to replace it before the deal is ruined. Comedy, with David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney's Christmas celebrations are disrupted by the unexpected arrival of their estranged father - leaving the brothers doubtful they can trust him after such a long absence. Another chance to see the 1983 festive special of John Sullivan's comedy.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: One of Del's old flames turns up out of the blue, so Rodney and Grandad resolve to extinguish any passion that might still be smouldering in the Peckham wide boy's heart. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del spots another sure-fire winner and decides to enter the highly profitable tourist trade - and with Rodney and Grandad backing him 100 per cent, he is sure his open-top bus tour initiative will be a massive success. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney and Mickey Pearce are commissioned to make a community film, but Del-Boy soon gets in on the act, offering a role to anyone who wants one - provided they pay for the privilege.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney ties the knot with Cassandra, but Del has more on his mind than best man duties as the dreaded Driscoll brothers arrive at the Nag's Head baying for his blood over some stolen mobile phones. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina decides to soak away her worries in a flotation tank and is amazed at its life-changing effects on both herself and those around her - so amazed that she agrees to adopt a Romanian orphan and even attends an open day at Saffron's school. Award-winning comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina takes time out from being PR guru to the country's biggest stars to become involved with Patsy's fashion magazine. Cosmo and Vogue beware - two new lushes are in town. Comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, with guest appearances by Dawn French and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina hits 40 and goes into a panic at the realisation that she now officially has one foot in the grave - so Saffie decides to cheer her up by throwing a party. Unfortunately, the guests fail to get along, and it all ends in tears. Hit comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley, Julia Sawalha and June Whitfield.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Despite being reduced to living in a roadside motel and presenting an early-morning programme on Radio Norwich, Alan still dreams of launching a new show on the BBC. However, his meeting with chief commissioner Tony Hayers does not run smoothly. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Alan faces bankruptcy and is forced to choose between sacking all his staff or keeping a few on but downgrading his car. His choice becomes more complicated when he falls in love with Jill, one of his employees. Sitcom, starring Steve Coogan, with Felicity Montagu, Phil Cornwell, Julia Deakin, Barbara Durkin and Simon Greenall.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola and Olly lock themselves away in a hotel room to try to finish preparing an important speech for the annual party conference. However, it is Glenn who hits the spot when he enlists the help of a local people's champion with a tragic tale. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Chris Addison.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Shadow minister Peter Mannion is due to visit to check out the department before the general election - which is yet another distraction for Nicola on a day when nothing seems to be going right. However, while trying to force Glenn and Olly to kick-start her new initiative, she receives an important call. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam.(n)

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: Jill resorts to desperate measures to raise money for her trip to Cornwall, while a hit-and-run incident forces her to think on her feet. Meanwhile, Cath and Don try to sort out their marital difficulties. Starring Julia Davis and Angus Deayton.(n)

programme.title: jam
programme.desc: Offbeat comedy featuring bizarre and surreal sketches, including one in which a doctor treats patients while running a telephone sex line. Amelia Bullmore, David Cann, Julia Davis, Kevin Eldon and Mark Heap star.(n)

programme.title: jam
programme.desc: Offbeat comedy featuring bizarre and surreal sketches. Amelia Bullmore, David Cann, Julia Davis, Kevin Eldon and Mark Heap star.(n)

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: First episode of the surreal sketch show with the inimitable Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: First episode of Carla Lane's comedy. Middle-aged housewife Ria worries that life is passing her by and wonders if things will ever perk up. However, she is consumed with guilt on meeting new love interest Leonard, a lonely executive with time on his hands. Wendy Craig and Geoffrey Palmer star.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Mother's ambitious streak presents problems for the family when she sets out to become Secretary of the Ladies' Luncheon Club. Barbara Lott stars.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel feels uncomfortable to be surrounded by so many females after Sandy joins Judith and Jean in the Pargetter household. Comedy, starring Judi Dench, Geoffrey Palmer, Jenny Funnell and Moira Brooker.(n)

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads
programme.desc: First episode of the classic comedy sequel. Bob travels down to London in his efforts to find a suitable wedding present, where fate sees him reunited with Terry, returning home after a gruelling spell in the Army. Starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam.(n)

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads return to work on an ambitious engineering project, with new member Wyman filling in for his late, lamented dad Wayne. Reunited by Oz, who has secured the job of dismantling the world-famous Middlesbrough transporter bridge, they set about raising the necessary financial backing - but have a hard time persuading Dennis to join them. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais' popular comedy drama, starring Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Tim Healy.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del spots another sure-fire winner and decides to enter the highly profitable tourist trade - and with Rodney and Grandad backing him 100 per cent, he is sure his open-top bus tour initiative will be a massive success. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais' popular comedy drama, starring Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Tim Healy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy tries to defy his age by entering the annual barrel-rolling competition, and undergoes a gruelling training programme. Meanwhile, Pearl buys Howard a tropical fish tank as a gift. Long-running rural comedy, starring Brian Wilde and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The wily trio set about trying to find a new home for Smiler, whose wife has left him after 33 years of marriage and gone to live with her sister in Australia.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo is very upset to learn that that Nora Batty has taken Smiler as a lodger, so Foggy attempts to distract him from his depression by indulging in a spot of dancing. Brian Wilde and Bill Owen star.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to persuade Arkwright to buy a van, so he does not have to struggle with the shop's outdated delivery bike. He is pleasantly surprised when his skinflint uncle agrees - until he takes the vehicle out on the road. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Following a break-in, Arkwright buys a dog to keep away potential burglars. Unfortunately, his new investment also scares off the customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: With the family stuffed full of turkey and Nana supping snowballs like there's no tomorrow, it can mean only one thing - Christmas at the Royles', who are celebrating in typical fashion by congregating round the TV. But this year they have special guests - none other than the parents of Antony's posh girlfriend Emma. Ricky Tomlinson, Sue Johnston, Caroline Aherne and Craig Cash star in the Christmas show from 2000, with guest appearances by Sharon Duce and John Henshaw.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Denise and Dave bring baby David to visit and Anthony and Darren do Ali G impressions. Award-winning comedy, starring Caroline Aherne.(n)

programme.title: Gimme Gimme Gimme
programme.desc: Linda and Tom discover a dead body in their living room and spend the rest of the day trying to identify it, while a forlorn Spanish hunk only serves to complicate matters. Comedy, starring James Dreyfus and Kathy Burke.(n)

programme.title: Gimme Gimme Gimme
programme.desc: Tom gets a new cat that he hopes is destined to find fame on Coronation Street, while Linda starts a romance with a convicted serial killer. Comedy, starring Kathy Burke and James Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Dafydd's new career as a rent boy proves a success at the local mine, and Vicky shows off her dancing skills on the estate. Florence and Emily tackle their facial hair, while Bubbles bumps into her ex-husband (Rob Brydon) at the health spa. With Matt Lucas, David Walliams and guest star Cat Deeley.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The TV chef and food writer gives advice on how to tackle numerous parties with recipes for instant dips, lamb and sweet potato curry and a coconut macaroon meringue. Plus, she oversees a group of soccer fathers' culinary efforts and visits a local lamb producer.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The TV chef prepares a selection of Middle East-inspired recipes, including chicken and cous cous tagine, chickpea and aubergine salad, and yoghurt and apricot pots. Plus, Rachel cooks al fresco with a couple of biker friends and finds out how goat's yoghurt is made.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Silvena Rowe demonstrates how to make sujuk lamb sausage roll, plus chilli-scented king prawn and feta guvech.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Silvena Rowe prepares an ideal meal for a dinner party, including a whole chicken stuffed with pork, and tiramisu with candied pistachios.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal discovers that curry house classics such as vindaloo, bhuna, phal and onion bhaji were all invented in Britain, as he puts his own stamp on the most famous of them all - injecting whole poussins with tikka marinade and stuffing them with tikka masala. He also rustles up his own version of lamb biryani with a Bombay mix crust, creates giant poppadoms measuring almost a metre wide, and serves a new type of lager - `beeryani', infused with rice and pandan leaves. As a final nod to the British curry house experience, the chef makes a giant After Eight-inspired dessert, and dishes up his unique menu in a pop-up restaurant on the outskirts of Bradford.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal seeks inspiration from the nation's rich history of chocolate-making to create a supersized chocolate bar. With help from leading brands, the chef crafts a homage to several popular treats as part of the first-ever Great Bar of Britain, which he unveils at a feast. He also makes a `Moos bar' - a combination of beef nougat, shortbread biscuit, and beef and Guinness caramel - and a unique range of goodies in an edible box.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall cooks using produce from Britain's abundant spring harvest, including asparagus, artichokes and lamb. The shepherd's pie recipe is taste-tested against Delia Smith's cheat version with surprising results, and five Bristol families are challenged to turn an acre of city land into an urban smallholding. Plus, an update on the Chicken Out! campaign.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall prepares dishes using seasonal lettuce and spinach from his kitchen garden, and dandelion and burdock grown in the hedgerows. The experimental Bristol smallholding receives four saddleback pigs, and vegetarian Susan accepts the task of butchering a whole lamb's carcass. Plus, the chef's country honey is pitted against the city variety at a taste-off in Broadway market.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: The potatoes and radishes are ready for picking and the broad beans are de-podded for a luxurious dish of beans on toast. Jess chooses a batch of hens from a battery egg farm as the Bristol experiment to turn an acre of derelict city land into a smallholding continues. Back at River Cottage, Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall organises a foraging competition and finds his ducklings hatch days early.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Kinton Ramen, Summit Cafe, Kokom's Bannock Shack.
programme.desc: John Catucci returns to sample more of Canada's favourite comfort food, visiting Kinton's Ramen in Toronto, before taking in the Summit Cafe in Manitoba.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Happy Dog, Barb's Country Kitchen, Brit & Chips.
programme.desc: John Catucci proclaims his love for fully-loaded hot-dogs at Happy Dog, Cleveland, and crazy portions are the order of the day at Barb's Country Kitchen in Orangeville, Ontario.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With their numbers reduced from 10 to eight, the enthusiastic home cooks take part in the next stage of the contest, heading for Scone Palace near Perth. Here, they are challenged to bake their signature biscuits, scones and petit fours with meringues, choux pastry and macaroons. The judges are Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. programme.desc: Warm-up. Pete is homeless again and facing professional disappointment, so he turns to Artie Lange, who invites him to be on his podcast(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include a report on former Maryland Terps basketball player Juan Dixon; a profile of 2004 top MLB draft pick Matt Bush; and an examination of the "yips," including a chat with former baseball player Rick Ankiel(n)

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: Lady in the Water director M. Night Shyamalan puts PG-13 suspense on pause to tell this grim apocalyptic tale about a family fleeing a natural disaster that poses a grave threat to the whole of humanity. Philadelphia high-school science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) is discussing the disappearance of the bees with his students when the staff is summoned to the theater and briefed about a mysterious event that is currently unfolding in New York City. According to reports, citizens in the vicinity of Central Park have suddenly and inexplicably begun seizing up just before killing themselves by whatever means are at their disposal. As the phenomena begins to spread and talk of terrorism fills the airwaves, Elliot, his wife, Alma (Zooey Deschanel), their friend Julian (John Leguizamo), and his daughter, Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez), board a train bound for the presumed safety of the country. When the train screeches to a halt before arriving at its final destination, however, the frightened passengers are forced to fend for themselves as each consecutive news report paints an increasingly grim picture of the situation in more urbanized areas. Theories abound on what could be causing the unexplainable rash of suicides, but the only thing that everyone seems to agree on is that it's some kind of airborne contagion that is carried in the wind. It would appear that humankind's reign on planet Earth has come to an end, but perhaps if this small band of survivors can find a safe place to lie low until this all blows over, all hope for survival of the species might not be lost just yet(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Somebody's Dead. In the premiere of an adaptation of Liane Moriarty's novel set in a seemingly idyllic seaside California town, a suspicious death at an elementary school fund-raiser exposes rivalries simmering beneath the superficial comity among some of the parents(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Serious Mothering. Madeline feels slighted by Renata and gets bad news about her community-theatre production; Ziggy asks Jane why they moved to Monterey; Celeste tells Perry they should seek counseling; Nathan and Ed have a tense meeting about their wives(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Living the Dream. Madeline organizes a trip to compete with Annabella's birthday party to annoy Renata(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Push Comes to Shove. Nathan hosts a couples dinner for Madeline and Ed to discuss a "parenting paradigm" for Abigail. Meanwhile, Celeste prepares for a city-council meeting about Madeline's play, and clashes with Perry over the prospect of her returning to work; Jane meets with Ziggy's teacher to talk about classroom bullying; and Madeline stumbles upon a clue about Jane's past(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Once Bitten. Madeline gets encouraging news about the play from her director, but is unnerved by a significant change in his demeanor. Meanwhile, Principal Nippal and Ms. Barnes discuss the Ziggy-Amabella situation with Jane; and Celeste has a solo session with Dr. Reisman, who presses her for more details on her marriage(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Burning Love. Madeline worries about Jane and the can of worms she opened. Meanwhile, Jane confronts Renata; Bonnie tells Nathan about Abigail's secret project; and Ed and Madeline have a candid conversation about the lack of passion in their marriage(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: A renowned Harvard psychiatrist (with a concealed fear of heights) takes over as director of the PsychoNeurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous after the last administrator dies under suspicious circumstances(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: Irreverent black comedy following the exploits of a host of offbeat characters at a medical unit during the Korean war, including surgeons Hawkeye Pierce and Trapper John McIntyre who create havoc with their martini parties and practical jokes while the war rages around them. The film spawned a successful television series and won an Oscar for best screenplay, written by Ring Lardner Jr(n)

programme.title: Defending Your Life
programme.desc: Two spirits find love in an afterlife way station where fates are determined(n)

programme.title: Making 'Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising'
programme.desc: A look at "Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising," a sequel to the 2014 comedy that finds a young couple plagued by yet another Greek menace: the sisters of Kappa Kappa Nu. The film stars Seth Rogen, Zac Efron and Chloë Grace Moretz, and is directed by Nicholas Stoller(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: A typical day in the life of Craig, an alright guy with some crazy friends. Like Smokey, who has 24 hours to pay back Deebo, South Central's nastiest thug - or else. Trouble is, neither Craig's mother nor his main squeeze have the cash. As time ticks away, the chance this pair will ever see Saturday is fading fast(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Upon Jake's release from prison, the brothers are reunited and visit the orphanage they grew up in--only to discover that it is in danger of being shut down by the county for failure to pay taxes. With a little help from James Brown as a revival preacher, the Blues Brothers are divinely inspired to raise the $5,000 that the orphanage needs to stay open(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: After their first adventure, Elwood was given a prison sentence of 18 years. Upon release he learns that his former partner Jake has died. Determined to get the band back together, he picks up 10-year-old Buster and Mack McTeer. They travel across the country to Louisiana for a battle of the bands(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: In Terry Gilliam's inventive fantasy, the famed 19th-century writers get caught up in a real-life fairy tale involving a haunted forest where girls have been disappearing. Matt Damon, Heath Ledger, Jonathan Pryce, Monica Bellucci, Peter Stormare, Lena Headey(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbor troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door in this hysterical comedy sequel. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: A typical day in the life of Craig, an alright guy with some crazy friends. Like Smokey, who has 24 hours to pay back Deebo, South Central's nastiest thug - or else. Trouble is, neither Craig's mother nor his main squeeze have the cash. As time ticks away, the chance this pair will ever see Saturday is fading fast(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Ice Cube returns as South Central L.A. slacker Craig Jones for this raucous sequel to 1995's "Friday." Jones hightails it to his lottery-winning uncle's suburban crib to hide from an escaped con he helped put in jail in the first film. Tom "Tiny" Lister Jr., Mike Epps, John Witherspoon(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Upon Jake's release from prison, the brothers are reunited and visit the orphanage they grew up in--only to discover that it is in danger of being shut down by the county for failure to pay taxes. With a little help from James Brown as a revival preacher, the Blues Brothers are divinely inspired to raise the $5,000 that the orphanage needs to stay open(n)

programme.title: Evil Dead 2: Dead by Dawn
programme.desc: This sequel is better, funnier, scarier and superior to the first indie gore-fest. Never before has there been such an originally funny and unique horror film that never for a moment takes itself seriously. Lots of fun!(n)

programme.title: Haiku Tunnel
programme.desc: Co-writer, co-director and star Josh Kornbluth crafts a winning satire of the corporate 9-to-5 grind. Kornbluth plays a neurotic San Francisco temp, a likable aspiring novelist whose world unravels when he takes a permanent position at a law firm. The "perm" must deal with corporate idiosyncrasies, a powerful boss and the challenge of mailing out 17 "very important letters."(n)

programme.title: Problem Child 2
programme.desc: Little menace Junior Healy and his dad, Ben, move to idyllic Mortville. Ben quickly catches the eye of every woman in town, including the evil, but very rich LaWanda. Junior joins forces with Trixie to foil LaWanda's plans to marry his good-natured dad(n)

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: David Spade stars in this frisky comedy an inept restaurateur who dognaps a pooch belonging to his new neighbor, a beautiful French cellist (Sophie Marceau) so he'll have an excuse to talk to her. He decides to keep the pup for awhile, then return him and be the hero. Patrick Bruel, Artie Lange, Mitchell Whitfield(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: Damon Wayans and Adam Sandler star in Bulletproof an action comedy from Universal Pictures. The story of a cop, a crook, and a beautiful friendship gone sour takes place in a world where loyalty goes to the highest bidder and the only one you can trust turns out to be your worst enemy. Once partners in crime, Archie Moses and Rock Keats are now on opposite sides of the law. Each feels betrayed by the other, but as fate would have it they're back together and on the run(n)

programme.title: Shanghai Noon
programme.desc: When Princess Pei Pei is kidnapped from the Forbidden City, Wang feels personally responsible and insists on joining the guards sent to rescue the Princess, who has been whisked away to the United States. In Nevada and hot on the trail of the kidnappers, Wang is separated from the group and soon finds himself an unlikely partner with Roy O'Bannon, a small time robber with delusions of grandeur. Together, the two forge onto one misadventure after another(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: Slick Hollywood fixer Eddie Mannix is pressed into action when a superstar actor is kidnapped and held for ransom by a mysterious group. Mannix races to quietly collect the ransom money before the gossip mags catch wind of the scandal(n)

programme.desc: A mother-daughter team of con artists target wealthy men for their fortunes(n)

programme.desc: The hilarious hit comedy in which Marisa Tomei won an Oscar for her dazzling performance as Lisa, the girlfriend of Joe Pesci's loser lawyer Vinny. Unfortunately his first case just happens to involve his young cousin Ralph Macchio, who has been wrongly accused of the murder of a shop assistant. Down in Alabama for the trial, it's up to Vinny to save the day with a dynamite performance (provided that he can stay awake in court for long enough) - and hang on to Lisa as their relationship hits the rocks(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Can Mia prove her regal relative wrong?(n)

As Astro Boy grows up, he befriends a gang of scavengers who live in a desolate wasteland on Earth and eventually returns to his hometown of Metro City to protect the populace from a group of dangerous robots(n)

programme.title: The Great Muppet Caper
programme.desc: The Great Muppet Caper is the second Muppet film and it is considerably more complex than its predecessor, The Muppet Movie, which was essentially just a road movie. As the film begins, Kermit the Frog and Fozzie Bear are reporters who have failed to bag a story of a London jewel heist, which happened under their watch. The real criminals managed to escape and frame Miss Piggy as the thief. Kermit, Fozzie and the Great Gonzo set out on a mission to solve the mystery and track down the criminals who stole the Baseball Diamond. There are fewer star cameos and songs in The Great Muppet Caper than in The Muppet Movie, although appearances from John Cleese and Charles Grodin are particularly memorable(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip
programme.desc: Through a series of misunderstandings, Alvin, Simon and Theodore come to believe that Dave is going to propose to his new girlfriend in New York City and dump them. They have three days to get to him and stop the proposal, saving themselves not only from losing Dave but possibly from gaining a terrible stepbrother(n)

programme.title: The Last Mimzy
programme.desc: Chris O'Neil and Rhiannon Leigh Wryn star as siblings Noah and Emma Wilder in Bob Shaye's intelligent family sci-fi adventure drama that doesn't talk down to children. While staying at their family beach house near Seattle, the two find a box of things that look like toys, but prove to be far more mysterious. Sent back in time, the 'toys' are trying to pass on a message about the future. And the more Noah and Emma play with the objects from the box, the more their intelligence grows. But one day Noah lines up the toys and accidentally activates a powerful force that creates a state-wide blackout. With her family under arrest by the FBI, Emma must make sense of the messages Mimzy, the toy rabbit, has been telepathically communicating to her(n)

programme.desc: At the height of the Cuban missile crisis in the 1960s, Calvin Webber takes his pregnant wife Helen underground into a cavernous air raid shelter. Misinterpreting a plane crash as war, they spend the next 35 years entombed there. Their son, Adam, is brought up learning foreign languages, dancing, boxing and playing in the astro-turfed 'back yard'. When he is sent to get supplies from the world above, he meets Eve and, in this romantic comedy, discovers the good and bad sides of 1990s America(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: Writer and director Robert Rodriguez returns to the family-friendly adventure of his Spy Kids movies with this three-dimensional action opus. Max (Cayden Boyd) is a ten-year-old boy who doesn't get along with his peers and is constantly bullied at school. But Max has an active imagination, and he has a pair of very special imaginary playmates -- Shark Boy (Taylor Lautner), a human-shark half-breed cared for by a pack of great whites, and Lava Girl (Taylor Dooley), a girl with superpowers who can conjure heat and fire at will. Max may be a creative boy, but what he doesn't know is that Shark Boy and Lava Girl really do exist, and he is recruited to help them as they do battle against Mr. Electricity, a super-villain determined to deprive children of their sleep. Shot and originally released in the 3-D format, The Adventures of Shark Boy and Lava Girl also stars David Arquette and Kristin Davis as Max's parents, and George Lopez as a schoolteacher; writer and director Rodriguez wrote the film's story in collaboration with his then seven-year-old son, Racer Rodriguez(n)

However, suffering from a severe case of writer's block, Chevalier passes off the novel as his own, starting a chain of events that sets Benjamin out on a mission to prove that the work is his(n)

Greetings card writer Tom falls for his boss's new assistant, who claims she doesn't believe in love. Throughout the next 500 days Tom experiences the highs and lows of their coming together and falling apart(n)

They decamp to New York, sealing Hell shut, but, without a regular supply of souls, Satan could literally evaporate into thin air. His only hope lies in his nerdy youngest son Nicky, but even with the help of Valerie and a talking dog, he's going to have problems persuading his bigger brothers to return to Hell and save Dad in Steven Brill's laugh-out-loud comedy(n)

programme.desc: Romantic comedy in which a newlywed couple on honeymoon in Europe discover that the girl's disapproving family and ex-boyfriend are following them in an attempt to sabotage their relationship. (HD)(n)

programme.desc: A local black community is unhappy that their community is effectively being run by whites. As the heat rises on a hot summer's day in Brooklyn, so the racial tension, which has so far lay dormant under the surface, begins to rise(n)

programme.desc: Horror remake about a young couple who become embroiled in a bloody battle of wits with the psychotic hitchhiker they stop to pick up on their way home for spring break. programme.desc: This stunning sci-fi sequel finds the nations of Earth banding together to fight off a second alien invasion, 20 years after the first attack brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered extraterrestrial technology, the alliance readies itself for a massive war(n)

programme.title: Formula 51
programme.desc: Samuel L Jackson plays a pharmaceutical genius who has used his knowledge to make a fortune in illegal drugs, particularly with Formula 51, named after its potency above heroin, crack, anything. But instead of selling it to his drug lord employer, he jets to Liverpool where Robert Carlyle is acting as broker for Ricky Tomlinson, who's prepared to offer $20m for the formula - money Jackson would love to spend if he can stay alive long enough in Ronny Yu's fast moving crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: In a side-splitting film that brings together some of comedy's sharpest talent, 30 Rock star Tina Fey, Amy Poehler and writer/director Michael McCullers join forces to tell the story of two women, one apartment and the nine months that will change their lives. The always winning and wry Fey portrays a focused and driven New York career woman who desperately wants a baby but is physically unable to carry the child herself. Undaunted, she recruits a South Philly working girl (Poehler) to act as her surrogate. Everything goes according to plan until a pregnant Poehler shows up on Fey's doorstep with no place to live, and suddenly two very different women are joined together to create a very unexpected family(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: John Oliver's satirical look at the previous week's news, politics and headlines(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

programme.desc: Alfred Hitchcock was at the height of his fame and creativity when, in 1962, he chose an unknown fashion model to star in his most ambitious film, The Birds. But as he sculpted Tippi Hedren into the perfect Hitchcock blonde of his imagination, he became obsessed with the impossible dream of winning the real woman's love. His failure destroyed both of their careers. Screenwriter Gwyneth Hughes has interviewed Tippi Hedren and surviving members of Hitchcock's crew. This film tells their full tragic story(n)

programme.desc: When the Manchester-born funnyman died in June 1993, he was just weeks away from recording An Audience with Les Dawson. When his victim collapses, however, he takes her to hospital, where ex-lover Helen corners him and has him arrested. What will he reveal about Josh and Melanie, and the attack on club owner Liam? programme.title: Shadow of Doubt
programme.desc: The deaths of 11-year-old Skyla Whitaker and her friend,13-year-old Taylor Paschal-Plackershot, who were shot dead in a rural area of Oklahoma in June 2008. When police later questioned Kevin Sweat over the 2011 murder of his fiance Ashley Taylor, they realised they were able to link the crimes.(n)

programme.title: Forbidden: Dying for Love
programme.desc: A relationship that turned deadly between a troubled violin prodigy and her former therapist. Musician Lia Tricomo tortured John Alkins - who has already been dismissed from his post for crossing professional boundaries - by cutting his throat, and stabbing and strangling him.(n)

programme.title: Who Killed Jane Doe
programme.desc: The case of Pamela Knight, who in 2005 vanished on her youngest son's birthday. Seven years later, two men found her remains buried under an abandoned shed. It transpired her husband, Paul Anthony Knight, had killed her and hidden her body before disappearing himself.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of a respected Kentucky businesswoman, found bludgeoned and stabbed to death in her home. Detectives followed a long path to pursue her killer.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The case of Linda Strait, whose body was found along the Spokane River in September 1982. Some of the detectives involved spent the rest of their careers searching for her killer.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 51-year-old trucking company manager Jackie Markham who vanished in December 2000. Detectives found her Florida home undisturbed with her car in the garage. Her purse was later located in a ditch in a rough neighbourhood, but then the trail ran cold.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Attempts by investigators to identify charred bones at a killer's dumping ground in Florida.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: In response to a tip-off, investigators find a dog with a chain embedded in its neck. Vets strive to reverse the damage, while the team tries to bring the owner to justice.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Officers respond to reports of cruelty involving a large snapping turtle and deal with a litter of poorly puppies.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of big game hunter Bob, who was is fooled by a predatory con-artist and put a $1,000 deposit on a non-existent Thunderbird.(n)

programme.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: The affairs of R'n'B legend Johnnie Taylor. When the musician died in May 2000 his six children expected to split his sizable estate - until three strangers came forward declaring they were also his offspring. The claims heralded a two-year legal battle.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The discovery of bones on a deserted island, which led to a couple's trial for murder - 11 years after the crime had been committed.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The case of Sandi Johnson, a loving mother with model looks, who disappeared the day of her son's fifth birthday party. Years later, her body - and killer - were found.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The story of a 28-year-old lured into a relationship by an online prankster. What unfolded was a twisted tale of how an innocent girl paid the price for another person's suffering.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Louisiana student Mickey Shunick, who went missing after a night out in May 2012. Police failed to make a breakthrough until they spoted her on surveillance footage. Eventually a registered sex offender pleaded guilty to killing the 21-year-old, and also being responsible for the death of another woman whose body had been found in September 1999.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How victims' family members and friends can assist police in their inquiries after the body of a missing person is found and identified.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The shotgun murders of John and Carolyn Tarwacki. When John Tarwacki Sr discovered the bodies of his son and daughter-in-law in February 2010, the only story told at the scene was found in the snow. Boot prints revealed the path the killer had taken, but the search for a motive led police in a startling direction.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 23-year-old Leah Roberts who vanished in March 2000 after leaving North Carolina to do some soul-searching on a cross-country trip. The Jeep in which she was travelling was found damaged and abandoned a week later 3,000 miles from her home, close to the Canadian border, with some of her personal possessions scattered around it.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The 2011 murder of Melissa White, whose body was found in her backyard. When investigators took a closer look at the neighbours, they unearthed a secret and had to work out whether it could be connected with the killing.(n)

programme.desc: The case of University of Florida student Christian Aguilar, who vanished from his campus in September 2012. Police were stumped until CCTV footage took the case in a shocking new direction, helping lead them to the 18-year-old's body.(n)

programme.title: Summer Catch
programme.desc: This summer could not be more crucial for Ryan Dunne, a blue-collar kid with aspirations to become a major league baseball player. Every summer, the hottest college ball players descend upon Cape Cod to pursue their baseball dreams during the day and blow off steam in town at night. The first local boy in years to earn a slot in the team, Ryan finally got his shot but the temptations off-field are getting in the way of his commitment to the game. Soon, a beautiful young woman who summers in the town with her family distracts Ryan. As the friction builds between his loyal townie friends and his cocky teammates, Ryan's rivalry with hotshot teammate Eric comes to a head. When a major league scout comes along, however, he tries to push the pangs of romance and player rivalry aside, because his sports talent may be his only ticket out of the small industrial town(n)

programme.desc: Scott Miller heads to the Isle of Wight to help with a risky procedure on a Bengal tiger, and he also performs surgery on a donkey with a sinus problem.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Phil Spencer takes his cocker spaniels out in Windsor Great Park, Clive Anderson is on the Isle of Mull with his terrier and Katy Brand is in Constable country with her dog.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Med
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton visits the Spanish island of Mallorca, where he discovers an Arab bath house that is over 1,000 years old in Palma's old town.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barber Kenny Flynn hosts the first dinner party in Liverpool. His evening has a `big kids' theme, so he prepares burger buns striped like a zebra and baby octopuses that resemble spiders. His guests are Nigerian model Cynthia Umezulike, rock music enthusiast Glen Simpson, businessman Rob Spicer and fine-dining enthusiast Jilly Pollock.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Multiple business owner Rob Spicer welcomes the diners to his home for the second party in Liverpool. He is convinced his `historical leader' theme will be a hit, but there is a shock in store as one of the guests reveals a secret about herself.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Model and barrister Cynthia Umezulike hosts the third dinner party in Liverpool, and hopes her meal including tribal fish, a traditional Nigerian jeloff and an exotic fruit platter will impress her guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rock music enthusiast Glen Simpson hosts the fourth dinner party in Liverpool. He rustles up sticky blackened pork and an Elvis-inspired dessert of deep fat-fried chocolate bars with home-made peanut butter and banana ice-cream, but grievances among the guests threaten to derail the evening's entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jilly Pollock hosts the fifth and final party in Liverpool, inviting her fellow contestants to a black-tie event. She prepares a selection of self-styled dishes for her diners, including figs, hot beef and berry delight, and hopes an evening of ballroom dancing will ease tensions following the previous night's arguments.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Dunsandles Guest House in New Brighton, Merseyside, where owner Alan Johnson and his professional sidekick Dave Owen hope to win the title - but a scandal with some unwanted hair on the bed sheets is not a good start, and two guests feel they are making an exhibition of themselves with a tea-trolley in full view of the neighbours.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the second day of the competition, the contestants visit the Lady Teal Hotel Boat on the waterways near Burnley in Lancashire, and owners Nick and Gina Mead hope to impress them with an afternoon of entertainment out on the locks. At breakfast, one of the guests admits to not enjoying his stay.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From York House in Tetbury, Gloucestershire, where Brock Bergius hopes that his cheeky sense of humour and perfectionist nature will help him win the competition. He is in his element making saucy jokes during an afternoon of sausage making, but his reluctance to stray from the menu at breakfast leaves some of his guests disappointed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Heyford House in Oxfordshire, where Leo and Sonya Brooke-Little hope to impress the contestants with their hospitality. The afternoon event is boxing, which Brock Burgius sees as the perfect opportunity to settle some scores with his fellow competitors.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's winner is announced as the B&B owners meet for the last time to thrash out their differences. Feedback includes criticism of a badly positioned tea tray, controversy over a hot chocolate and accusations of overenthusiastic hosting.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog-lover Kerry Bolwell-Williams kicks off a week of dinner parties in the Welsh valleys, where she hopes that a full choir and a simple menu will impress her guests and make her an early contender for the £1,000 prize. However, she does not react well when it is suggested that her home has a rather distinctive smell.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Food-lover and theme park fan Dave Morris hosts the second dinner party in the Welsh valleys, hoping his home-grown herbs, hand-picked fruit and complicated menu will win him the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Shop owner Tasnim Sardar hosts the third night of the competition in the Welsh valleys, and hopes her Pakistani-inspired party will secure her the £1,000 prize. Financial advisor Gill Leonard likes her curries to be hot and spicy, and is particularly pleased by Tasnim's curried cauliflower.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ryan Woodward hosts on the fourth night in the Welsh valleys and has put a lot of thought into his evening, but each of his courses goes wrong - from a bread blunder to a clam crisis. He hopes an Ibizan dance lesson and drinks served in his hot tub will help to turn the party around.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in the Welsh valleys, financial advisor Gill Leonard dons the oven gloves to entertain the other contestants, and there is a dramatic start to the evening thanks to a mock fire-breathing dragon. Later, the host makes a remarkable revelation to her shocked guests.(n)

programme.title: How to Lose Weight Well
programme.desc: Dr Xand van Tulleken and dietician Hala El-Shafie are on hand as dieters attempt the most hyped and written about diets on the market today. In this offering, Emilie and Harriet have two weeks to slim down for a photo shoot, while cousins Natasha and Chiquita go on a six week diet for Natasha's wedding. And brothers Gary and Wayne want to slim down for a darts competition due in four months. Xand also investigates how exposure to extreme temperatures can affect weight loss.(n)

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: Roman general Maximus Decimus Meridius is a casualty of a power struggle between the corrupt Emperor Commodus and the senate. Ordered to be put to death along with his family, he escapes his would-be killers but is sold into slavery as a gladiator - but uses his fame in the arena to fight against the tyrant. Oscar-winning period epic, with Russell Crowe, Joaquin Phoenix, Derek Jacobi and Oliver Reed, in his last film role.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The 100th episode of the series focuses on the love between patients and their nearest and dearest. Sir John Cockburn, who's 89, arrives at St George's with acute abdominal pain and medics think it could be an abdominal aortic aneurysm and he faces emergency surgery. Meanwhile, 68-year-old Mick and his wife Linda have been involved in a head-on car crash. Mick took the brunt of the impact and has multiple injuries from top to toe that could be life-changing. The couple fell in love after leaving previous relationships, making a happy life together in their mobile home. And 10-year-old Niall is brought to A&E after falling 8ft from a tree on a family picnic. He's broken his arm so badly it looks like a banana, and orthopaedic doctors need to work out how to get it back in place.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to family-owned Italian restaurant Giuseppi's in Macomb Township, Michigan. Father and son Joe and Sam Borgia's constant fighting is driving customers away, and Gordon discovers one of the restaurateurs is concealing a serious health problem. Nevertheless, he sets about rescuing them from disaster and turning around the failing business.(n)

programme.title: How to Lose Weight Well
programme.desc: Dr Xand van Tulleken and dietician Hala El-Shafie are on hand as dieters attempt the most hyped and written about diets on the market today. In this offering, Emilie and Harriet have two weeks to slim down for a photo shoot, while cousins Natasha and Chiquita go on a six week diet for Natasha's wedding. And brothers Gary and Wayne want to slim down for a darts competition due in four months. Xand also investigates how exposure to extreme temperatures can affect weight loss.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Guests Micky Flanagan, Mel Giedroyc, Stephen Graham and Katherine Ryan join team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson to uncover the public's most popular talking points, answering questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country. Jimmy Carr hosts the irreverent panel show.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Brighton to secretly restore a 1984 Audi UR Quattro, which has been under a tarpaulin on a drive for 10 years. Owner Barry has dreamed of working on the vehicle, but health issues have left him sapped of energy and unable to fulfil his wish.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness instructor Tanya Manock offers up a Mediterranean-themed menu as she kicks off a week of dinner parties at her home in Rochdale, Greater Manchester, where one of her guests - medium Dean Fox - stumbles upon a plethora of lingerie in the bedroom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Food-lover Rod Tonge hosts the second dinner party in Rochdale, Greater Manchester, hoping his efforts will win him the £1,000 cash prize. However, his chances are low as he has already insulted fitness instructor Tanya Manock, and HR manager Claire Lemon does not have high hopes for his entertaining skills.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: HR manager Claire Lemon hopes to compensate for her `imperfect cooking skills' with her bubbly personality and superior hosting ability as she hosts on day three of the dinner-party challenge in Rochdale, Greater Manchester. But tension rises when Tanya barely touches the starter - or the main course.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Psychic medium Dean Fox puts his cooking skills to the test during the fourth dinner party in Rochdale, Greater Manchester. His main course goes down well with his fellow diners, but his pudding jeopardises his bid to pick up the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the last night in Rochdale, Greater Manchester, and the turn of feisty mum Sadiya Hussein to host. The tension between Sadiya and Tanya threatens to reach boiling point, and the evening takes a curious turn when Sadiya decides to put psychic medium Dean Fox's clairvoyant powers to the test.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Wiltshire residents Peter and Karen Greaves find a property for £50,000 or less on Spain's Costa Blanca.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Bedfordshire couple John and Elaine Want plan a permanent move to the Alicante region of southern Spain, and Sara Damergi takes them to view potential homes within their budget of £70,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Dungannon, Northern Ireland: Fort of the Earls.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Dungannon, Northern Ireland, to investigate a former 17th-century stronghold. Seized in 1602 by English forces, the site is now the location of an abandoned British Army base. With only one picture of the old fortress still in existence, the crew struggles to uncover the truth about this important site.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit Northamptonshire to assess a Saxon skeleton discovered by surprised homeowners Morris and Pat Jones while digging a pond in their back garden. Phil Harding and the archaeological experts look for a forgotten graveyard.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend fix up a historic racing car, an Austin Healey Sprite, which has been kept in a garage since 1968. The challenge is to restore the car so that Sir Stirling Moss, who raced in the vehicle at Sebring in the USA in 1962, can get back behind the wheel.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel tries to fix a cocker spaniel's leg problems by fitting two bionic back feet, before launching a series of investigations into what is causing a cat to drag its leg. Plus, a Westie puppy with a fractured knee arrives, but it cannot keep still.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Micha and Crispin's beloved Bengal cat Loki has been hit by a car, while Faberge, an elderly Chinese crested dog with a fabulous wardrobe, is brought in by owners Julie and Suzanne after suffering seizures. Noel Fitzpatrick and the team also meet a deerhound called Willow, who has broken her neck, and with a high-risk operation to consider, her owners must decide whether to proceed.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Carpenter John Cadney's family home has been a tent for the past 16 years due to lack of funds and has decided to import an environmentally friendly four-bedroom log cabin from Finland and assemble it himself. With hundreds of pre-cut pieces of wood to fit together, his skills will be much in demand. Presented by Kevin McCloud.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott tries to help a Spanish rescue cat with a chronic eye condition, and a heartbroken young owner finds out the shocking news about her puppy.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick infuses implants with stem cells to grow bone and cartilage in two ground-breaking operations. An energetic seven-month-old Italian Spinone is brought in after scans reveal it has a hole in its shoulder bone. With regenerative medicine opening up new options, the vet offers the puppy's owner a custom-made implant to plug the hole. He also treats a seven-year-old border collie left in constant pain from a broken leg after being hit by a car five months ago. Owner Lisa is reluctant to amputate, so Noel proposes a new treatment that has never been tried before.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old motorcyclist Sam is airlifted to St George's after crashing into a bus and being thrown under a car. He is placed in an induced coma and CT scans reveal Sam has bruising to his lungs, a ruptured kidney, a broken thigh bone and a fractured spine. The priority of the medics is is to stop his internal bleeding, while Sam's parents are rushed to the hospital by police. Meanwhile, seven-year-old Raheem arrives in A&E with his dad Dennis after cutting his wrist while playing at home, and 59-year-old Therese turns up with a painful lump on her finger.(n)

programme.desc: Gotta Dance. Steph (Jodie Sweetin) wants very much to become a professional dancer, only to find out that the lessons are harder than she thought they'd be. programme.desc: Nicky and/or Alexander. Upon bringing her new twin sons home, Becky (Lisa Loughlin) outfits the infants with specially colored booties so she can tell Baby Alex from Baby Nick. Meanwhile, Danny (Bob Saget) learns to his surprise that he enjoys the blunt outspokenness of Becky's temporary replacement on "Wake Up San Francisco." programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.desc: Derry Clarke, Catherine Fulvio and Paul Flynn visit Huntington Castle in Co Carlow, where they serve up a feast involving a roast pig on the spit, boiled goose and sheep's feet. Derry also butchers a lamb in Tullow and goes fruit picking on a Ballon farm.(n)

programme.title: Designing Ireland
programme.desc: Angela Brady and Sandra O'Connell continue their celebration of Irish design, considering how centuries of migration, invasion and colonisation have resulted in a constant ebb and flow of influence from abroad. Examples include a modern take on the Norman Tower House at the campus of Trinity College, Dutch graphic designers' influence on Ireland's visual culture in the 1950s and how the Scandinavian Design Report in 1962 led to the setting up of the influential Kilkenny Design Workshops.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy's attempts to celebrate her birthday with an intimate night at home are interrupted by the news that Bernadette has gone into labour. however, it transpires that Howard, Raj and Stuart may have rushed the expectant mother to the hospital too early, with Raj having difficulty keeping the gender of the unborn child a secret.(n)

programme.title: Apres Match of the Day
